jobs.title: Technical Support Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Role

Technical Support Engineers are the first line of defense for our users, debugging tricky issues, building automations to streamline workflows, and ensuring every interaction with Cursor is smooth and impactful. You'll partner closely with product and engineering to champion the voice of the customer and shape how AI-powered developer support scales.

Responsibilities

  • Provide in-depth technical support via support tickets and Slack messages, resolving complex user-reported issues and ensuring high-quality customer interactions.

  • Debug, reproduce, and troubleshoot software bugs and usability problems.

  • Design and build internal tools and automations to scale support operations.

  • Represent Anysphere in technical conversations with enterprise users and developers.

  • Partner with Product and Engineering to escalate critical issues and feed insights into the roadmap.

  • Maintain and expand user-facing documentation and internal knowledge bases to empower both customers and teammates.

Requirements

  • Experience in technical support, software engineering, or a related technical role.

  • Strong understanding of software development workflows; experience with IDEs, LLMs, and building with AI.

  • Strong debugging skills and a passion for digging deep into technical problems.

  • Clear, concise communication skills to explain complex concepts to technical and non‑technical audiences.

  • Self-starter with curiosity, creativity, and a bias for action.

About

We're Anysphere, the team behind Cursor.

Our mission is to automate coding. The first step in our journey is to build the best tool for professional programmers, using a combination of inventive research, design, and engineering.

We're a group of engineers and scientists who've built beloved products, created large OSS projects, started at-scale businesses, won olympiad medals, and published significant research (e.g. tmm1, ian, luke, phil, federico, aman, sualeh).

Our organization is very flat, and our team is small and talent dense. We particularly like people who are truthseeking, passionate, and creative. We enjoy spirited debate, crazy ideas, and shipping code.

We're in-person with cozy offices in North Beach, San Francisco and Manhattan, New York, replete with well-stocked libraries. Our investors include Andreessen Horowitz, OpenAI, Jeff Dean, John Schulman, and the founders of Stripe and Github.

Applying

If there appears to be a fit, we'll reach to schedule 2-3 short technicals. After, we'll schedule an onsite in our office, where you'll work on a small project, discuss ideas, and meet the team.

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Enterprise
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Role

As an Enterprise Product Engineer at Anysphere, you'll architect, implement, and deploy projects end-to-end to build enterprise-grade features that help large organizations adopt and scale with Cursor.

You might be a fit if...

  • You have an entrepreneurial spirit and love creating outsized business impact.

  • You want to be at the frontier of AI transformation with the best companies in the world.

  • You're passionate about building great products that blend excellent engineering with a taste for models and design.

  • You have a propensity for creative ideas and have a knack for making powerful tools without compromising their ease-of-use.

About

We're Anysphere, the team behind Cursor.

Our mission is to automate coding. The first step in our journey is to build the best tool for professional programmers, using a combination of inventive research, design, and engineering.

We're a group of engineers and scientists who've built beloved products, created large OSS projects, started at-scale businesses, won olympiad medals, and published significant research (e.g. tmm1, ian, luke, phil, federico, aman, sualeh).

Our organization is very flat, and our team is small and talent dense. We particularly like people who are truthseeking, passionate, and creative. We enjoy spirited debate, crazy ideas, and shipping code.

We're in-person with cozy offices in North Beach, San Francisco and Manhattan, New York, replete with well-stocked libraries. Our investors include Andreessen Horowitz, OpenAI, Jeff Dean, John Schulman, and the founders of Stripe and Github.

Applying

If there appears to be a fit, we'll reach to schedule 2-3 short technicals. After, we'll schedule an onsite in our office, where you'll work on a small project, discuss ideas, and meet the team.

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Product
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Role

Product engineers create the software we ship to our users, in particular our editor. As a member of our core product team, you'll join us in inventing a new, better way to build software.

You might be a fit if...

  • You've built a great product.

  • You blend excellent engineering with a taste for models and design.

  • You have a propensity for creative ideas and have a knack for making powerful tools without compromising their ease-of-use.

Sample projects include:

  • Inventing new interfaces and UX for reviewing PRs of AI-generated code

  • Sprinting for two weeks to build a new product vertical from scratch (e.g., AI bug detection)

  • Running experiments and A/B tests on millions of users to push the frontier of agent quality - ex sub-agents, memories, and PR retrieval

About

We're Anysphere, the team behind Cursor.

Our mission is to automate coding. The first step in our journey is to build the best tool for professional programmers, using a combination of inventive research, design, and engineering.

We're a group of engineers and scientists who've built beloved products, created large OSS projects, started at-scale businesses, won olympiad medals, and published significant research (e.g. tmm1, ian, luke, phil, federico, aman, sualeh).

Our organization is very flat, and our team is small and talent dense. We particularly like people who are truthseeking, passionate, and creative. We enjoy spirited debate, crazy ideas, and shipping code.

We're in-person with cozy offices in North Beach, San Francisco and Manhattan, New York, replete with well-stocked libraries. Our investors include Andreessen Horowitz, OpenAI, Jeff Dean, John Schulman, and the founders of Stripe and Github.

Applying

If there appears to be a fit, we'll reach to schedule 2-3 short technicals. After, we'll schedule an onsite in our office, where you'll work on a small project, discuss ideas, and meet the team.

jobs.title: Software Engineer, ML Research
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Role

Research engineers build the systems that make Cursor intelligent. Often that involves staring down ambiguous research problems. And inventing clever techniques for solving them.

Sample projects include...

  • Training the world's best next-action-prediction and apply models

  • Inventing inference tricks for faster code edits

  • Creating retrieval models and PL techniques to solve codebase awareness

You might be a fit if...

  • You've trained and served state-of-the-art models.

  • You're unfazed hunting down kernel-level memory leaks on large-scale MOE runs.

  • You love using the most productive tool for the job, whether that be creating a model, leveraging an existing one, or something other than ML entirely.

About

We're Anysphere, the team behind Cursor.

Our mission is to automate coding. The first step in our journey is to build the best tool for professional programmers, using a combination of inventive research, design, and engineering.

We're a group of engineers and scientists who've built beloved products, created large OSS projects, started at-scale businesses, won olympiad medals, and published significant research (e.g. tmm1, ian, luke, phil, federico, aman, sualeh).

Our organization is very flat, and our team is small and talent dense. We particularly like people who are truthseeking, passionate, and creative. We enjoy spirited debate, crazy ideas, and shipping code.

We're in-person with cozy offices in North Beach, San Francisco and Manhattan, New York, replete with well-stocked libraries. Our investors include Andreessen Horowitz, OpenAI, Jeff Dean, John Schulman, and the founders of Stripe and Github.

Applying

If there appears to be a fit, we'll reach to schedule 2-3 short technicals. After, we'll schedule an onsite in our office, where you'll work on a small project, discuss ideas, and meet the team.

jobs.title: Account Executive
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Role

As an Account Executive at Anysphere, you'll be responsible for driving revenue growth by building strategic relationships with customers and helping them realize the full potential of Cursor for their development teams. You’ll cover the full spectrum, from fast‑growing mid‑market to the world’s largest enterprises, adapting your playbook to each.

You'll work closely with engineering organizations to understand their development workflows, demonstrate how Cursor can transform their productivity, and guide them through the implementation and adoption process. This role combines technical understanding with sales expertise to help enterprises reimagine how software development can be accelerated with AI.

Responsibilities

  • Become a trusted product expert; guide prospects through trials, evaluations, and enterprise rollouts.

  • Build and manage a healthy pipeline, meeting and exceeding quarterly targets.

  • Lead multi-threaded sales cycles across Engineering, Product, Security, Procurement, and Legal.

  • Develop executive relationships and day-to-day champions.

  • Quantify value with clear ROI cases tied to developer productivity and AI adoption.

  • Be the voice of the customer and influence the roadmap with actionable feedback.

  • Partner closely with Field Engineering and Technical Account Managers to deliver outcomes from proof of concept to expansion.

About

We're Anysphere, the team behind Cursor.

Our mission is to automate coding. The first step in our journey is to build the best tool for professional programmers, using a combination of inventive research, design, and engineering.

We're a group of engineers and scientists who've built beloved products, created large OSS projects, started at-scale businesses, won olympiad medals, and published significant research (e.g. tmm1, ian, luke, phil, federico, aman, sualeh).

Our organization is very flat, and our team is small and talent dense. We particularly like people who are truthseeking, passionate, and creative. We enjoy spirited debate, crazy ideas, and shipping code.

We're in-person with cozy offices in North Beach, San Francisco and Manhattan, New York, replete with well-stocked libraries. Our investors include Andreessen Horowitz, OpenAI, Jeff Dean, John Schulman, and the founders of Stripe and Github.

Applying

If there appears to be a fit, we'll reach to schedule 2-3 short technicals. After, we'll schedule an onsite in our office, where you'll work on a small project, discuss ideas, and meet the team.

jobs.title: Technical Account Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Role

We’re hiring the first Technical Account Managers to partner with some of our most strategic enterprise customers. As a TAM, you’ll drive adoption, deliver measurable business value, and help shape how AI transforms engineering teams. You’ll act as the connective tissue between customer stakeholders and our internal teams, influencing both the Cursor roadmap and each customer’s implementation strategy.

This role is highly cross‑functional and customer‑facing. You understand software development workflows, care deeply about developer tools, and love helping engineering organizations succeed at scale.

Responsibilities

  • Build and grow deep relationships with engineering leaders and power users at key accounts.

  • Partner with Field Engineering and Sales to deliver a seamless post‑sale experience.

  • Drive adoption of Cursor by aligning usage with business objectives and engineering goals.

  • Guide customers on best practices for rollout, prompt strategy, context configuration, and internal enablement.

  • Serve as the customer’s voice internally and influence roadmap priorities.

  • Provide strategic account planning and regular business reviews with VP‑ and CTO‑level stakeholders.

  • Monitor account health, usage patterns, and product engagement to drive renewals and expansion.

Requirements

  • Strong communication skills and executive presence — comfortable whiteboarding with developers and pivoting to value with a CTO.

  • Deep understanding of the software development lifecycle and engineering org structures.

  • Fluency in technical workflows, AI tooling, and developer productivity (even if you haven’t been a full‑time engineer).

  • Customer‑obsessed with a knack for strategic thinking and problem‑solving.

  • Thrives in a startup environment: scrappy, proactive, and adaptable.

  • Experience in TAM, Solutions Architecture, Customer Success, or Consulting for enterprise software.

About

We're Anysphere, the team behind Cursor.

Our mission is to automate coding. The first step in our journey is to build the best tool for professional programmers, using a combination of inventive research, design, and engineering.

We're a group of engineers and scientists who've built beloved products, created large OSS projects, started at-scale businesses, won olympiad medals, and published significant research (e.g. tmm1, ian, luke, phil, federico, aman, sualeh).

Our organization is very flat, and our team is small and talent dense. We particularly like people who are truthseeking, passionate, and creative. We enjoy spirited debate, crazy ideas, and shipping code.

We're in-person with cozy offices in North Beach, San Francisco and Manhattan, New York, replete with well-stocked libraries. Our investors include Andreessen Horowitz, OpenAI, Jeff Dean, John Schulman, and the founders of Stripe and Github.

Applying

If there appears to be a fit, we'll reach to schedule 2-3 short technicals. After, we'll schedule an onsite in our office, where you'll work on a small project, discuss ideas, and meet the team.

jobs.title: Field Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Role

We’re hiring Field Engineers to partner with prospective and strategic enterprise customers. As a Field Engineer, you’ll be the technical face of Anysphere in the field — helping customers evaluate Cursor, guiding them through proofs of concept, and ensuring they see the full value of AI in their engineering workflows.

You’ll work hand-in-hand with Sales, Product, and Engineering to scope solutions, demonstrate capabilities, and act as a trusted advisor to technical stakeholders. This is a highly customer-facing role where you’ll combine deep technical fluency with strong communication skills to drive adoption and influence product direction.

Responsibilities

  • Partner with Account Executives to lead technical discovery, demos, and proof-of-concept engagements.

  • Build trusted relationships with engineering leaders, architects, and developers, serving as their technical advisor.

  • Translate customer requirements into solution designs, guiding them on best practices for rollout, prompt strategy, and context configuration.

  • Develop and deliver technical presentations, whiteboard sessions, and hands-on workshops tailored to customer needs.

  • Act as the customer’s technical advocate internally, influencing roadmap priorities and escalating feedback to Product and Engineering.

  • Collaborate with post-sales teams to ensure a smooth handoff and successful customer onboarding.

  • Maintain deep knowledge of Cursor’s capabilities and competitive landscape to position our value effectively.

  • Support strategic account planning and help drive expansion opportunities with technical validation.

Requirements

  • Strong communication skills and executive presence — equally comfortable coding alongside developers or presenting to CTOs.

  • Deep understanding of the software development lifecycle, modern engineering org structures, and developer productivity challenges.

  • Hands-on technical ability — you don’t need to be a full-time engineer, but you should be fluent in technical workflows, AI tooling, and debugging complex environments.

  • Customer-obsessed with a knack for translating technical details into business impact.

  • Experience in Field Engineering, Solutions Architecture, Pre-Sales, or Consulting for enterprise software.

  • Thrives in a startup environment: resourceful, adaptable, and proactive in creating solutions.

About

We're Anysphere, the team behind Cursor.

Our mission is to automate coding. The first step in our journey is to build the best tool for professional programmers, using a combination of inventive research, design, and engineering.

We're a group of engineers and scientists who've built beloved products, created large OSS projects, started at-scale businesses, won olympiad medals, and published significant research (e.g. tmm1, ian, luke, phil, federico, aman, sualeh).

Our organization is very flat, and our team is small and talent dense. We particularly like people who are truth-seeking, passionate, and creative. We enjoy spirited debate, bold ideas, and shipping code.

We’re in-person with cozy offices in North Beach, San Francisco and Manhattan, New York, complete with well-stocked libraries. Our investors include Andreessen Horowitz, OpenAI, Jeff Dean, John Schulman, and the founders of Stripe and GitHub.

Applying

If there appears to be a fit, we’ll reach out to schedule 2–3 short technical conversations. After, we’ll arrange an onsite visit to our office, where you’ll work on a small project, discuss ideas, and meet the team.

 - Build trusted relationships with engineering leaders, architects, and developers, serving as their technical advisor.

 - Translate customer requirements into solution designs, guiding them on best practices for rollout, prompt strategy, and context configuration.

 - Develop and deliver technical presentations, whiteboard sessions, and hands-on workshops tailored to customer needs.

 - Act as the customer’s technical advocate internally, influencing roadmap priorities and escalating feedback to Product and Engineering.

 - Collaborate with post-sales teams to ensure a smooth handoff and successful customer onboarding.

 - Maintain deep knowledge of Cursor’s capabilities and competitive landscape to position our value effectively.

 - Support strategic account planning and help drive expansion opportunities with technical validation.


REQUIREMENTS

 - Strong communication skills and executive presence — equally comfortable coding alongside developers or presenting to CTOs.

 - Deep understanding of the software development lifecycle, modern engineering org structures, and developer productivity challenges.

 - Hands-on technical ability — you don’t need to be a full-time engineer, but you should be fluent in technical workflows, AI tooling, and debugging complex environments.

 - Customer-obsessed with a knack for translating technical details into business impact.

 - Experience in Field Engineering, Solutions Architecture, Pre-Sales, or Consulting for enterprise software.

 - Thrives in a startup environment: resourceful, adaptable, and proactive in creating solutions.


ABOUT

We're Anysphere, the team behind Cursor.

Our mission is to automate coding. The first step in our journey is to build the best tool for professional programmers, using a combination of inventive research, design, and engineering.

We're a group of engineers and scientists who've built beloved products, created large OSS projects, started at-scale businesses, won olympiad medals, and published significant research (e.g. tmm1, ian, luke, phil, federico, aman, sualeh).

Our organization is very flat, and our team is small and talent dense. We particularly like people who are truth-seeking, passionate, and creative. We enjoy spirited debate, bold ideas, and shipping code.

We’re in-person with cozy offices in North Beach, San Francisco and Manhattan, New York, complete with well-stocked libraries. Our investors include Andreessen Horowitz, OpenAI, Jeff Dean, John Schulman, and the founders of Stripe and GitHub.


APPLYING

If there appears to be a fit, we’ll reach out to schedule 2–3 short technical conversations. After, we’ll arrange an onsite visit to our office, where you’ll work on a small project, discuss ideas, and meet the team.

jobs.title: GTM Systems
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Role

As GTM Systems at Anysphere, you’ll be responsible for owning and operating the tools and processes that power our Sales, Marketing, and Partnerships functions. You’ll work closely with GTM leadership, Revenue Operations, and Product teams to implement, integrate, and optimize our systems, ensuring the GTM organization runs efficiently and scales with Anysphere’s growth.

This is a highly impactful role where you’ll be hands-on in building workflows, managing our tech stack, and delivering data-driven insights that enable Cursor adoption across mid-market and enterprise customers. You’ll thrive if you’re detail-oriented, systems-savvy, and excited to roll up your sleeves to make our GTM machine run smoothly.

Responsibilities

  • Own the day-to-day administration of our GTM systems (Salesforce, marketing automation, sales engagement, BI tools, etc.), including configuration, integrations, and troubleshooting.

  • Translate business requirements from Sales, Marketing, and Partnerships into scalable workflows, dashboards, and automations.

  • Maintain and improve lead routing, territory management, account hierarchy, and opportunity tracking to ensure clean and efficient processes.

  • Build reports and dashboards that provide visibility into pipeline health, bookings, campaign performance, and ROI.

  • Partner with Revenue Operations and Sales Leadership to support forecasting, target tracking, and performance measurement.

  • Ensure data accuracy and consistency across systems, implementing governance processes to improve data quality.

  • Work with Product, Engineering, and Finance to embed pricing, deal support, and approvals into GTM workflows.

  • Evaluate and implement new GTM tools, integrations, and process improvements that enhance team productivity.

  • Provide hands-on support and training for GTM team members to ensure adoption and best practices.

  • Continuously identify bottlenecks and opportunities for automation to drive operational efficiency.

About Anysphere

We're Anysphere, the team behind Cursor. Our mission is to automate coding. The first step in our journey is building the best tool for professional programmers, using a combination of inventive research, design, and engineering.

We’re a small, talent-dense team of engineers and scientists who’ve built beloved products, created large OSS projects, started at-scale businesses, won Olympiad medals, and published significant research. We thrive on curiosity, spirited debate, and bold ideas that push boundaries — and we ship code fast.

We’re in-person with cozy offices in North Beach, San Francisco and Manhattan, New York, complete with well-stocked libraries. Our investors include Andreessen Horowitz, OpenAI, Jeff Dean, John Schulman, and the founders of Stripe and GitHub.

Qualifications

  • 5–8 years of experience in GTM Systems, Sales Operations, or Revenue Operations in a high-growth SaaS or technology company.

  • Strong hands-on expertise with Salesforce administration and GTM tool stacks (e.g., Outreach, Gong, Clay, etc).

  • Experience building and maintaining workflows, automation, and reporting to support sales and marketing processes.

  • Strong understanding of SaaS business models, pipeline management, and GTM metrics.

  • Proficiency with BI/reporting tools (Hex, Retool, or similar) and SQL is a plus.

  • Detail-oriented with strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.

  • Comfortable working directly with GTM teams, gathering requirements, and translating them into system solutions.

  • Excited to roll up your sleeves, own projects end-to-end, and continuously improve GTM systems and processes.

  • Passion for AI, developer productivity, and building the operational foundation for the future of software development.

Applying

If there appears to be a fit, we’ll reach out to schedule 2–3 short introductory and technical conversations. Afterward, we’ll arrange an onsite visit to our office, where you’ll work on a small project, discuss ideas, and meet the team.

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Infrastructure
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Role

Infrastructure engineers build the platform that supports Cursor's functionality. Sometimes this means inventing highly-available distributed systems. Sometimes this means dealing with woes of scaling to millions of programmers.

Sample projects include...

  • Creating a retrieval system that processes 10,000,000,000+ files

  • Staring at esoteric flame graphs to performance engineer our reranking library

  • Working with many databases, proxies, caches, task queues, and orchestration systems

  • Shipping infra for safely computing import graphs and shadow lints

About

We're Anysphere, the team behind Cursor.

Our mission is to automate coding. The first step in our journey is to build the best tool for professional programmers, using a combination of inventive research, design, and engineering.

We're a group of engineers and scientists who've built beloved products, created large OSS projects, started at-scale businesses, won olympiad medals, and published significant research (e.g. tmm1, ian, luke, phil, federico, aman, sualeh).

Our organization is very flat, and our team is small and talent dense. We particularly like people who are truthseeking, passionate, and creative. We enjoy spirited debate, crazy ideas, and shipping code.

We're in-person with cozy offices in North Beach, San Francisco and Manhattan, New York, replete with well-stocked libraries. Our investors include Andreessen Horowitz, OpenAI, Jeff Dean, John Schulman, and the founders of Stripe and Github.

Applying

If there appears to be a fit, we'll reach to schedule 2-3 short technicals. After, we'll schedule an onsite in our office, where you'll work on a small project, discuss ideas, and meet the team.

jobs.title: Growth
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Cursor is an AI developer tool used by many of the world’s top engineering teams. As an early member of our growth team, you'll be critical in developing and executing demand generation initiatives that accelerate enterprise adoption of Cursor.

This person will have significant autonomy to own growth goals and lead high-impact experiments, working closely with sales, marketing, and engineering.

What You’ll Do

  • Design, execute, and analyze outbound experiments from hypothesis to conclusion with rigor, with the goal of discovering outlier plays to double down on

  • Craft copy tailored to email / LinkedIn with tasteful messaging that captures the value of the product and our target audience

  • Manage the inbox in real-time and funnel leads to sales reps

  • Collaborate with sales to ensure messaging resonates for both technical and business buyers

  • Construct highly targeted lists for outbound (driven by PLG data, website intent, content engagement, etc.)

Who You Are

  • 1-5 years at a high-velocity startup where you owned growth experiments end-to-end

  • Experience dialing up outbound via cold email and LinkedIn

  • Proven A/B testing track record - move fast on copy, channels, and audience hypotheses

  • Comfortable wearing “analyst + creative” hats: SQL/spreadsheets by morning for list building, content copywriting by afternoon

  • Fearless experimentation - you are always thinking out of the box and are unafraid to fail

  • Strong bias toward action, not afraid to dive into the weeds and do whatever it takes to ship

  • You are a natural creative who can execute with precision

  • Fast-moving, detail-oriented, and comfortable in a high-context, high-trust environment

  • Nice-to-haves

    • Tool fluency - you are familiar with growth tools like Salesforce, Clay, Unify, Phantom Buster

    • Have experience with PLG signals to pinpoint high-intent users

jobs.title: Sales Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Sales Manager – GTM

📍 San Francisco, United States | Full-time | In-person
Team: GTM
Company: Anysphere (the team behind Cursor)

Role

Anysphere is reimagining how code is written. Our GTM team is the bridge between that future and the world’s top engineering organizations. As a Sales Manager, you’ll work closely with founders, engineers, and operators at leading companies to help them realize the full potential of Cursor.

This is not a traditional sales role. You’ll blend strategy, storytelling, product understanding, and customer empathy to build trusted relationships and help engineering teams adopt a fundamentally new way of working.

Your work might include:

  • Building and owning strategic relationships with technical decision-makers

  • Running high-context, high-conviction sales processes from first meeting to close

  • Translating user feedback into insights that shape our GTM strategy and product roadmap

  • Helping define what world-class sales looks like at Anysphere

You’ll work closely with the founding team and have a direct impact on how our product is adopted by the world.

You might be a fit if you:

  • Have 3–8 years of experience in high-touch technical sales (e.g. enterprise software, developer tools, or AI platforms)

  • Are energized by working with engineers and love diving into how things work

  • Are comfortable owning ambiguous problems and creating clarity through action

  • Communicate crisply and have a bias toward speed and quality

  • Are curious, entrepreneurial, and excited to build in an early-stage environment

About Anysphere

We’re building Cursor—the best AI coding tool for professionals. Our mission is to automate coding, and we’re doing that through a combination of deep research, great design, and strong engineering.

We’re a tight-knit team of engineers and scientists who’ve built influential products, led OSS projects, founded companies, and published cutting-edge research. We work in person from our cozy, library-like office in North Beach, San Francisco.

Backed by Andreessen Horowitz, OpenAI, Jeff Dean, and the founders of Stripe and GitHub.

How to Apply

Instead of a resume, send us a short video (≤90 seconds) that shows who you are and why you want to join the GTM team at Anysphere.
📧 hiring@anysphere.inc

jobs.title: Technical Account Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Role

We’re hiring the first Technical Account Managers to partner with some of our most strategic enterprise customers. As a TAM, you’ll drive adoption, deliver measurable business value, and help shape how AI transforms engineering teams. You’ll act as the connective tissue between customer stakeholders and our internal teams, influencing both the Cursor roadmap and each customer’s implementation strategy.

This role is highly cross‑functional and customer‑facing. You understand software development workflows, care deeply about developer tools, and love helping engineering organizations succeed at scale.

Responsibilities

  • Build and grow deep relationships with engineering leaders and power users at key accounts.

  • Partner with Field Engineering and Sales to deliver a seamless post‑sale experience.

  • Drive adoption of Cursor by aligning usage with business objectives and engineering goals.

  • Guide customers on best practices for rollout, prompt strategy, context configuration, and internal enablement.

  • Serve as the customer’s voice internally and influence roadmap priorities.

  • Provide strategic account planning and regular business reviews with VP‑ and CTO‑level stakeholders.

  • Monitor account health, usage patterns, and product engagement to drive renewals and expansion.

Requirements

  • Strong communication skills and executive presence — comfortable whiteboarding with developers and pivoting to value with a CTO.

  • Deep understanding of the software development lifecycle and engineering org structures.

  • Fluency in technical workflows, AI tooling, and developer productivity (even if you haven’t been a full‑time engineer).

  • Customer‑obsessed with a knack for strategic thinking and problem‑solving.

  • Thrives in a startup environment: scrappy, proactive, and adaptable.

  • Experience in TAM, Solutions Architecture, Customer Success, or Consulting for enterprise software.

About

We're Anysphere, the team behind Cursor.

Our mission is to automate coding. The first step in our journey is to build the best tool for professional programmers, using a combination of inventive research, design, and engineering.

We're a group of engineers and scientists who've built beloved products, created large OSS projects, started at-scale businesses, won olympiad medals, and published significant research (e.g. tmm1, ian, luke, phil, federico, aman, sualeh).

Our organization is very flat, and our team is small and talent dense. We particularly like people who are truthseeking, passionate, and creative. We enjoy spirited debate, crazy ideas, and shipping code.

We're in-person with cozy offices in North Beach, San Francisco and Manhattan, New York, replete with well-stocked libraries. Our investors include Andreessen Horowitz, OpenAI, Jeff Dean, John Schulman, and the founders of Stripe and Github.

Applying

If there appears to be a fit, we'll reach to schedule 2-3 short technicals. After, we'll schedule an onsite in our office, where you'll work on a small project, discuss ideas, and meet the team.

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Product
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Role

Product engineers create the software we ship to our users, in particular our editor. As a member of our core product team, you'll join us in inventing a new, better way to build software.

You might be a fit if...

  • You've built a great product.

  • You blend excellent engineering with a taste for models and design.

  • You have a propensity for creative ideas and have a knack for making powerful tools without compromising their ease-of-use.

Sample projects include:

  • Inventing new interfaces and UX for reviewing PRs of AI-generated code

  • Sprinting for two weeks to build a new product vertical from scratch (e.g., AI bug detection)

  • Running experiments and A/B tests on millions of users to push the frontier of agent quality - ex sub-agents, memories, and PR retrieval

jobs.title: Data Scientist, Growth
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Role

As an early member of Cursor’s data team, you’ll help build an AI data program operating at incredible scale while partnering directly with founders and area leads. You’ll work hands‑on across the entire data stack and at the bleeding edge of AI, turning billions of user–AI interactions into strategy that gets users to “aha” faster and expands their usage.

Sample projects include:

  • Run high‑leverage growth experiments: Design and analyze experiments that drive earlier activation, improve conversion, and land users on the right subscription tier-directly influencing strategy with leadership.

  • Optimize tier economics: Evaluate the health of each tier, quantify retention and revenue drivers, and surface high‑ROI opportunities for meaningful tier differentiation.

  • Up-level our AI harness: Analyze billions of user-LLM interactions to improve how new users select models, write prompts, and experience success in agentic coding workflows, operating at the frontier of AI data science with data from every major model provider.

You might be a fit if...

  • You're scrappy, pragmatic, and thrive in environments where you can work across multiple product areas at once.

  • You’ve worked directly on Growth, especially product-led or pricing initiatives, and you know how to turn data into decisions that move metrics.

What you'll do...

  • Partner with area leads in Growth, Enterprise, Finance, and Product to shape data-informed decisions across the business.

  • Define, track, and own metrics like conversion and self-serve revenue that multiple teams and leadership depend on.

  • Run experiments end-to-end: design, analyze, and translate into clear product recommendations.

  • Build pipelines, dashboards, and analyses that make self-serve insights accessible and trustworthy.

  • Establish data culture and foundations as an early member of the data team.

You should apply if...

  • You have at least 4+ years of full-time data science experience.

  • You’ve been an early data scientist at a hyper-growth startup or research org.

  • You know how to be scrappy and ship insights across multiple product areas.

  • You’ve worked on Growth, especially product-led or pricing-related growth.

  • You’ve worked with subscription businesses, moving customers up tiers or optimizing revenue.

  • You’re fluent in SQL and Python, and can write pipelines to unblock yourself.

  • You have strong opinions about AB testing, conversion funnels, and growth accounting.

  • You can turn complex data into clear insights and stories for engineers, PMs, and execs.

  • You care deeply about accuracy and detail.

Bonus points

  • Hands-on experience with dbt and analytics engineering.

  • Machine learning applied to growth problems: LTV prediction, churn modeling, attribution.

  • Experience working on productivity software or AI tooling.

About

We're Anysphere, the team behind Cursor.

Our mission is to automate coding. The first step in our journey is to build the best tool for professional programmers, using a combination of inventive research, design, and engineering.

We're a group of engineers and scientists who've built beloved products, created large OSS projects, started at-scale businesses, won olympiad medals, and published significant research (e.g. tmm1, ian, luke, phil, federico, aman, sualeh).

Our organization is very flat, and our team is small and talent dense. We particularly like people who are truthseeking, passionate, and creative. We enjoy spirited debate, crazy ideas, and shipping code.

We're in-person with cozy offices in North Beach, San Francisco and Manhattan, New York, replete with well-stocked libraries. Our investors include Andreessen Horowitz, OpenAI, Jeff Dean, John Schulman, and the founders of Stripe and Github.

Applying

If there appears to be a fit, we'll reach to schedule 2-3 short technicals. After, we'll schedule an onsite in our office, where you'll work on a small project, discuss ideas, and meet the team.
jobs.descriptionPlain:
ROLE

As an early member of Cursor’s data team, you’ll help build an AI data program operating at incredible scale while partnering directly with founders and area leads. You’ll work hands‑on across the entire data stack and at the bleeding edge of AI, turning billions of user–AI interactions into strategy that gets users to “aha” faster and expands their usage.

Sample projects include:

 - Run high‑leverage growth experiments: Design and analyze experiments that drive earlier activation, improve conversion, and land users on the right subscription tier-directly influencing strategy with leadership.

 - Optimize tier economics: Evaluate the health of each tier, quantify retention and revenue drivers, and surface high‑ROI opportunities for meaningful tier differentiation.

 - Up-level our AI harness: Analyze billions of user-LLM interactions to improve how new users select models, write prompts, and experience success in agentic coding workflows, operating at the frontier of AI data science with data from every major model provider.

You might be a fit if...

 - You're scrappy, pragmatic, and thrive in environments where you can work across multiple product areas at once.

 - You’ve worked directly on Growth, especially product-led or pricing initiatives, and you know how to turn data into decisions that move metrics.

What you'll do...

 - Partner with area leads in Growth, Enterprise, Finance, and Product to shape data-informed decisions across the business.

 - Define, track, and own metrics like conversion and self-serve revenue that multiple teams and leadership depend on.

 - Run experiments end-to-end: design, analyze, and translate into clear product recommendations.

 - Build pipelines, dashboards, and analyses that make self-serve insights accessible and trustworthy.

 - Establish data culture and foundations as an early member of the data team.

You should apply if...

 - You have at least 4+ years of full-time data science experience.

 - You’ve been an early data scientist at a hyper-growth startup or research org.

 - You know how to be scrappy and ship insights across multiple product areas.

 - You’ve worked on Growth, especially product-led or pricing-related growth.

 - You’ve worked with subscription businesses, moving customers up tiers or optimizing revenue.

 - You’re fluent in SQL and Python, and can write pipelines to unblock yourself.

 - You have strong opinions about AB testing, conversion funnels, and growth accounting.

 - You can turn complex data into clear insights and stories for engineers, PMs, and execs.

 - You care deeply about accuracy and detail.

Bonus points

 - Hands-on experience with dbt and analytics engineering.

 - Machine learning applied to growth problems: LTV prediction, churn modeling, attribution.

 - Experience working on productivity software or AI tooling.
   


ABOUT

We're Anysphere, the team behind Cursor https://cursor.com/.

Our mission is to automate coding. The first step in our journey is to build the best tool for professional programmers, using a combination of inventive research, design, and engineering.

We're a group of engineers and scientists who've built beloved products, created large OSS projects, started at-scale businesses, won olympiad medals, and published significant research (e.g. tmm1 https://github.com/tmm1, ian https://shaoruu.io/, luke https://lukemelas.github.io/, phil https://philkrav.com/posts/speculative/, federico https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=n8tK15oAAAAJ&hl=en, aman https://www.cursor.com/blog/llama-inference, sualeh https://www.sualehasif.me/).

Our organization is very flat, and our team is small and talent dense. We particularly like people who are truthseeking, passionate, and creative. We enjoy spirited debate, crazy ideas, and shipping code.

We're in-person with cozy offices in North Beach, San Francisco and Manhattan, New York, replete with well-stocked libraries. Our investors include Andreessen Horowitz, OpenAI, Jeff Dean, John Schulman, and the founders of Stripe and Github.



APPLYING

If there appears to be a fit, we'll reach to schedule 2-3 short technicals. After, we'll schedule an onsite in our office, where you'll work on a small project, discuss ideas, and meet the team.

jobs.title: Security GRC Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Role

Security GRC Engineers design, implement, and scale our governance, risk, and compliance (GRC) program. You will lead automation of compliance workflows, build self-serve tools to enable GTM teams, and ensure our products and infrastructure meet the highest security standards. This role combines technical implementation with strategic program development, directly shaping how we build trust with customers.

You might be a fit if…

  • Experience with GRC frameworks (SOC 2, ISO 27001, ISO 27701, ISO/IEC 42001).

  • Hands-on technical skills to automate compliance workflows and integrate with engineering systems.

  • Proven ability to balance technical implementation with program strategy.

  • Strong cross-functional collaboration skills, especially with engineering, GTM, and auditors.

Sample projects include:

  • Automate evidence gathering and continuous control testing.

  • Optimize compliance monitoring and alerting systems; provide guidance on remediation.

  • Generate security program KPIs and maintain a platform for documenting risks, controls, and assessments.

  • Build self-serve tools and automation to streamline customer security diligence.

  • Support GTM teams by providing scalable ways to address customer security concerns.

  • Maintain corporate security policies and map them to relevant frameworks.

  • Draft security best practices and drive company-wide awareness and training programs.

  • Lead the development and maturity of GRC strategies aligned with SOC 2, ISO 27001, ISO/IEC 42001, and related standards.

  • Partner with auditors, regulators, and business stakeholders to define and implement security requirements and controls.

  • Conduct security compliance reviews for new products, features, and vendors.

About

We're Anysphere, the team behind Cursor.

Our mission is to automate coding. The first step in our journey is to build the best tool for professional programmers, using a combination of inventive research, design, and engineering.

We're a group of engineers and scientists who've built beloved products, created large OSS projects, started at-scale businesses, won olympiad medals, and published significant research (e.g. tmm1, ian, luke, phil, federico, aman, sualeh).

Our organization is very flat, and our team is small and talent dense. We particularly like people who are truthseeking, passionate, and creative. We enjoy spirited debate, crazy ideas, and shipping code.

We're in-person with cozy offices in North Beach, San Francisco and Manhattan, New York, replete with well-stocked libraries. Our investors include Andreessen Horowitz, OpenAI, Jeff Dean, John Schulman, and the founders of Stripe and Github.

Applying

If there appears to be a fit, we'll reach to schedule 2-3 short technicals. After, we'll schedule an onsite in our office, where you'll work on a small project, discuss ideas, and meet the team.

jobs.title: Founding Technical Program Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Role

Drive execution excellence across high-impact technical initiatives at Cursor. As our founding TPM, you'll serve as the operational backbone that enables our engineering teams to ship faster while maintaining quality and coordination as we scale.

You might be a fit if...

  • You thrive in ambiguity and create structure from chaos.

  • You're an exceptional collaborator who builds trust instantly across all levels.

  • You have deep technical fluency and can engage meaningfully with ML and infrastructure teams.

  • You get energized by high-impact, unglamorous projects that move the company forward.

  • A 4-hour deadline gets you energized, not anxious

Sample projects include:

  • Scaling our client release process to support rapid shipping velocity

  • Running our incident review program to drive reliability improvements

  • Launching new AI models to production (performance optimization, supply chain coordination, A/B testing)

  • Jumping on critical fires and figuring out how to resolve them quickly

About

We're Anysphere, the team behind Cursor.

Our mission is to automate coding. The first step in our journey is to build the best tool for professional programmers, using a combination of inventive research, design, and engineering.

We're a group of engineers and scientists who've built beloved products, created large OSS projects, started at-scale businesses, won olympiad medals, and published significant research (e.g. tmm1, ian, luke, phil, federico, aman, sualeh).

Our organization is very flat, and our team is small and talent dense. We particularly like people who are truthseeking, passionate, and creative. We enjoy spirited debate, crazy ideas, and shipping code.

We're in-person with cozy offices in North Beach, San Francisco and Manhattan, New York, replete with well-stocked libraries. Our investors include Andreessen Horowitz, OpenAI, Jeff Dean, John Schulman, and the founders of Stripe and Github.

Applying

If there appears to be a fit, we'll reach out to schedule a few conversations. After, we'll schedule an onsite in our office, where you'll work on a small project, discuss ideas, and meet the team.
